_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Abengoa Bioenergy of Indiana is an ethanol plant located near Mount Vernon, Indiana currently producing

approximately 80-95 MM gallons of denatured ethanol per year. There have been no changes to ownership of Abengoa Bioenergy of Indiana since the facility was constructed in 2009.



Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policies:



Abengoa Bioenergy of Indiana has a commitment to worker and public safety. Abengoa Bioenergy

of Indiana's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated

substances. However, if a release does occur, plant personnel will respond to contain the release as

necessary according to Emergency Response Plans.



Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:



Abengoa Bioenergy of Indiana ethanol plant is located near Mount Vernon, Posey County, Indiana.



The facility operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week for the purpose of manufacturing fuel grade ethanol

from corn. The regulated substances under the RMP program is Denaturant.



Abengoa Bioenergy of Indiana has determined that the radius of impact from a worst-case release would be about 0.7 miles due to the amount of denaturant stored on site.



Off-site Consequence Analysis Results:



The worse case scenario at the facility is the release of all 749,874 pounds of denaturant.  The worse case endpoint is 0.7 miles from the center of the tank.  There are two businesses and one residence within the 0.7 miles.  



Although Abengoa Bioenergy of Indiana has numerous controls in place to prevent such a release and to

manage potential consequences, no credit for administrative controls or passive mitigation measures were

taken into account in evaluating this scenario.



Five Year Accident History:



Abengoa Bioenergy of Indiana has not had any spills on site in the five years. The facility is subject to RMP

upon delivery of substances onsite.



Emergency Response Program Information:



The Abengoa Bioenergy of India

na ethanol plant has several safety programs in place at the facility that

incorporate emergency response, including a Health and Safety Plan. An SPCC/SWPPP has also been revised and

implemented in accordance with applicable regulatory standards and timeframes.



The facility also conducts employee training as part of facility activities. Abengoa Bioenergy of Indiana

corporate policy places the utmost importance on worker, public and environmental safety, which is

reflected in facility plans and training activities.



A safety inspection, 5-year PHA review and a review of the facility's emergency response plan has been completed in conjunction with this RMP revision.
